text: Interesting article on the economics effects of IoT. From 2011, but still some interesting metaphors.  <http://www.mckinsey.com/business-functions/strategy-and-corporate-finance/our-insights/the-second-economy>

attachments.title: The second economy
attachments.text: Digitization is creating a second economy that’s vast, automatic, and invisible--thereby bringing the biggest change since the Industrial Revolution.

text: Brian wrote a controller that tracks the declination of the sun and sets the color/brightness of our Hue bulbs through the local bridge by pinging them every second... F.lux everywhere at home! It was nice to go in the shower this morning with the light at "night mode" (very dim and red) and by the time I finished getting ready, the light had gradually warmed up to its default brightness and color :blush::shower:
That is super rad. I wish I could do that at home but it would be a lot of bulbs
I think we have 5 total, one in each bathroom, one in bedroom, one in a living room lamp, and one in the library. Enough for mood lighting if we're hanging out at home at night (small condo)
